item.description:
This is the second session of our new HAC group, in which we try to understand the origins and contents of what's apparently an important book to our Jewish and Christian neighbors.

Please read the following:

  • From our series reference How to Read the Bible: A Guide to Scripture, Then and Now, by James L. Kugel.

    • Chapter 2. The Creation of the World, and of Adam and Eve 47-57
    • Chapter 3. Cain and Abel 58-68
    • Chapter 4. The Great Flood 69-80
    • Chapter 5. The Tower of Babel 81-88
    • Chapter 6. The Call of Abraham 89-106

  • The Wikipedia entries on:

    • "Book of Genesis"
    • "Lilith"



Please catch up with the readings from the first session. You'll get more out of the group if you're aware of Kugel's approach to the source material.

For more information, see http://www.cthumanist...
